conclusion: We need to find the work done by the frictional force as an object moves on a conveyor belt from point M to point N.
The object is gently placed on the conveyor belt above point M, and the conveyor belt moves with velocity v = 6 m/s.
The mass of the object is given as m = 3 kg, and the coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is μ = 0.3.
The distance between the two drive wheels is L1 = 10 m.
Frictional Force: The frictional force that opposes the motion of the object relative to the conveyor belt is given by F_friction = μ m g where g = 10 m/s² is the acceleration due to gravity.
Work Done by Friction: The work done by the frictional force is W = F_friction × d × cos(θ) where d is the displacement of the object, and θ is the angle between the force and displacement direction.

premise: Since the frictional force opposes the displacement, θ = 180°, and cos(180°) = -1.
F_friction = μ m g = 0.3 × 3 kg × 10 m/s²
The displacement d = L1 = 10 m, so W = -9 N × 10 m
The work done by friction on the object is W = F L = μ m g L = 54 J.
conclusion: The work done by the frictional force as the object is transported from point M to point N is 54 J.
